trial_identification.studytitle: A Study of RO4607381 in Stable Coronary Heart Disease Patients With Recent Acute Coronary Syndrome
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study Assessing the Effect of RO4607381 on Cardiovascular Mortality and Morbidity in Clinically Stable Patients With a Recent Acute Coronary Syndrome

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Dalcetrapib (RO4607381) Treatment: drugs - Evidence-based medical care for Acute Coronary Syndrome Treatment: drugs - Placebo
Experimental: Dalcetrapib (RO4607381) -
Placebo Comparator: Placebo -
Treatment: drugs: Dalcetrapib (RO4607381) 600mg po daily
Treatment: drugs: Evidence-based medical care for Acute Coronary Syndrome As prescribed
Treatment: drugs: Placebo po daily

primaryOutcome.outcome: Time to first occurrence of any component of the composite cardiovascular event (cardiovascular mortality and morbidity)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change from baseline in blood lipids and lipoprotein levels
Adverse events, lab parameters, vital signs, ECG

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study will evaluate the potential of RO4607381 to reduce cardiovascular morbidity and mortality in stable coronary heart disease patients with recent Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS) and evaluate the long term safety profile of the drug. Eligible patients in stable condition will be randomized to receive either RO4607381 600mg po or placebo po, daily, together with a background of standard medication for ACS (including aspirin, antihypertensives and statins). The anticipated time on study treatment is 2+ years, and the target sample size is 15,600 individuals.
